titlestmt.titleproper: Polish Junior League of Connecticut Collection CPAA 88.11
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Special Collections Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-12-08T10:51-0500

did.unittitle: Polish Junior League of Connecticut Collection
did.abstract: The collection illustrates history of an immigrant organization for young women of Polish descent devoted to friendship, charitable work and scholarship. It cover years from 1926 until 1988. It contains correspondence, minutes and extensive collection of clippings and photographs.
did.langmaterial: The material in the collection is chiefly English. Some clippings are in Polish.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Polish Junior League of Connecticut, Inc..

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Polish Junior League of Connecticut (PJL CT) was established in 1926 and incorporated in 1930. The organization's purpose was to unite "in fellowship the young Polish women of Connecticut, to combine their efforts so as to promote the welfare of this community, to all charitable work possible and make it of ever-increasing service to society." The PJL CT was a social service organization typical of many others, organizing a variety of events to raise funds for charitable and educational purposes. The types of events that it organized (most prominently the annual debutants ball : The Bal Menuet) were the same organized by other junior leagues. The distinctive feature of this group, which was a second-generation immigrant organization, was its combining of host society type functions with a clear ethnic identity. The Hartford New Britain Chapter dissolved in 1988.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The papers were donated to the CPAAMC by Helen Gallant, a former PJL officer in 1988. Second donation of PJL papers was donated by Ms Helen Chaikowski of 975 Tolland Street, East Hartford 06108 and consists largely of PJL scrapbooks. Ms Chaikowski was responsible for publicity and was PJL historian. The donation was made in April, 1989.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The original arrangement of the collection was kept. Folders were arranged chronologically.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Cite as: Polish Junior League of Connecticut collection (CPAA 88-11). Connecticut Polish American Archives, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, minute of meetings, newsletters, financial information and extensive documentation of Bal Menuet. Rich collection of clippings and photographs add to a visual history of the organization.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: All Bal Menuet programs have been digitized and are available on the CCSU library web site under Digital Collections.
